task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 118°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the main building, so I will look up by rotating the camera with a positive pitch delta to view the roof section that's currently out of frame.
My current heading is 0°N, which is not facing the target South-East building, so I need to rotate right by 118 degrees to reorient towards the target building to view it properly.
I am now facing the target building, but need to view its upper portion (roof) to estimate the full height, so I will rotate the camera up by 30 degrees to bring the roof into frame.
My heading has reset to 0°N, so I need to rotate right by 118 degrees to face the target South-East building again, maintaining the 30° upward pitch to view its upper section.
To view the full height of the target building, I will rotate the camera up by 30 degrees while maintaining my current southeast heading, allowing me to see the upper portion including the roof.

To correctly face the target southeast building and view its upper section, I will perform a custom rotation to set heading to 118° and pitch to 30° in one action, avoiding the previous heading reset issue.
I can now see the full height of the target building; counting the visible floor levels (each ~3 meters) and adding the roof section, the estimated total height is 21 meters.
